alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Nash; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 11:19PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of Vance, Warren, central Nash, eastern Granville, northwestern Halifax, northeastern Wake and Franklin Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1117 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oxford to 6 miles west of Zebulon. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, lightning, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Oxford, Nashville, Louisburg, Warrenton, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Franklinton and Norlina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Nash; Vance; Wake; Warren
